item.title: Sperm donor is legal father of child, rules Australian court
item.description: A man, who donated sperm so his gay friend, has parental rights over their daughter, according to a High Court verdict.

item.title: UN calls for 'prompt and thorough' probe into Morsi's death
item.description: The UN rights office demands investigation into Morsi's death as people across the Middle East mourn the ex-president.

item.title: China's Xi backs North Korea in op-ed for Pyongyang paper
item.description: Beijing supports Pyongyang's 'correct direction' in solving issues on the Korean Peninsula, Xi writes ahead of the trip.

item.title: Trump formally kicks off his 2020 re-election campaign
item.description: The US president, who has been holding campaign-style rallies since the 2016 election, launches his 2020 bid in Florida.

item.title: A 'muted' Johnson inches closer to PM chair after TV debate
item.description: Conservative leaders vying to get Britain's top post clash over Brexit deadline as Johnson surges ahead in the race.

item.title: Defying Trump, senator moves towards vote to stop Saudi arms sale
item.description: There are 22 measures objecting to a White House plan for $8bn in arms sales to Saudi Arabia without Congress approval.

item.title: 'Hacked to death': DRC violence survivors recall horrific scenes
item.description: At least 300,000 people have been forced to flee their homes since early June due to 'multiple attacks' between ethnic groups, with over 160 killed.

item.title: Shanahan withdraws from consideration to be US defence secretary
item.description: Trump says Mark Esper will be named new acting secretary of defense, prolonging period without confirmed defence chief.

item.title: How did Egyptian newspapers report Mohamed Morsi's death?
item.description: Coverage in Egyptian newspapers was relegated to inside pages with no mention of former leader's title.

item.title: 'Saving lives isn't a crime': Italy slammed for 'security decree'
item.description: Rescue workers pulling desperate migrants from the Mediterranean could face huge fines after entering Italian waters.

item.title: Mohamed Morsi's death: World reaction
item.description: Malaysia, Qatar pay tribute to former Egyptian president, but reaction from other governments has been largely muted.

item.title: Pompeo keeps Saudis off child soldier recruiters list: report
item.description: Pompeo dismisses his experts' findings that Saudi-led coalition has used underage fighters in Yemen, Reuters reports.

item.title: Gunmen 'kill dozens' in attack on two villages in central Mali
item.description: The attacks on Yoro and Gangafani 2 risk plunging the country deeper into a cycle of ethnic violence.

item.title: Paris Air Show: Supersonic plans to rival Concorde
item.description: Several projects at the Paris Air Show are competing to bring supersonic travel to paying customers.

item.title: Pompeo: US President Donald Trump does not want war with Iran
item.description: Top US diplomat says Washington will maintain pressure on Iran, but does not want the conflict with Tehran to escalate.

item.title: Who will be Britain's next prime minister?
item.description: Competition to be the next British prime minister was rife even before Theresa May's resignation.

item.title: What does Morsi's death mean for Egypt?
item.description: Egypt's only democratically elected president died on Monday while attending a court session in Cairo.

item.title: UK: Boris Johnson solidifies lead in race for prime minister
item.description: Dominic Raab crashes out of the contest to become Conservative Party leader, and next PM, after Tory MPs vote.

item.title: Sandy Hook massacre: Father of victim wins defamation lawsuit
item.description: Leonard Pozner wins lawsuit against book authors who claimed the school shooting that killed his son never happened.

item.title: Powerful earthquake strikes off coast of Japan
item.description: There were no immediate reports of damage or casualties from the tremor, which hit 85km off northwestern Honshu island.

item.title: Those who oppose military are 'enemies of Algeria': Army chief
item.description: Ahmed Gaid Salah accuses some parties of favouring constitutional vacuum in order to extend political crisis.

item.title: Al Jazeera's AJ Labs wins prestigious One World Media award
item.description: 'Lost Childhoods' is an interactive graphic novel exposing child abuse in Nigeria.

item.title: Turkey: Erdogan slams Egypt's 'tyrants' as thousands mourn Morsi
item.description: Mosques across Turkey hold prayer services for former Egyptian president, who died in a Cairo court on Monday.

item.title: US announces $250m in military aid to Ukraine
item.description: Pentagon renews commitments to Ukraine in struggle against Moscow-backed rebels.

item.title: Refugee girls in Beirut 'face sexual violence, forced marriage'
item.description: More than half the refugee girls living in Lebanon's capital face sexual violence and harassment regularly, report says.
